messages.message:
On UAT, the new results table behaves inconsistently when accessed from the *Validations* tab.
1. From the *Validation rules* view (all rules), click results table. -->You see results for all validation rules. 
2. Edit a prompt-based validation rule. -->You see results for the selected validation rule.
3. Click <--Back to return to *Validation rules* view. -->The results table doesn't change. I would expect it to reload results for all validations rules, as it does on the schema tab. 
4. Switch to a different view (either change to schema tab or switch to single document view) then come back to the Validation tab. -->You still see results for the previous, single validation rule. 
5. Edit a confidence threshold rule. -->A "something went wrong" error results.

i’m trying (but not yet able) to reproduce #5 which is an actual bug.

The other few points reflects a behavior of “selecting” validations vs selecting fields. For fields we only show the single field in the results table if its being edited. But for validations we don’t always have a full panel for the editing state so we just use whichever validation rule is selected (the one with the border around it)
we could/should probably just make leaving the prompt based rule de-select the rule (but it also brings up a broader point about selecting a validation rule not being super intuitive)

it looks like there’s some issue with ‘Rule 1’ in your project though which is probably causing the results table crash — it’s listed as a “project confidence” rule but it’s showing up under a class which shouldn’t happen
do you recall how this rule was created?

I don't remember how I created that rule. This is my ongoing test project, so :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-3:

Okaaay, I see now how the rule selector, specifically, determines what's shown in results. And I also see that I can click again to deselect a rule and return to all results. I'll make sure to note that.

yep — the other thing to note here that also affects point #4 is that we deliberately made the decision so that your selection state stays the same when switching across schema/validation views. So if you’re editing a field and then switch to validation tab, the editing field is preserved when you switch back. That’s also why you’re seeing the validation rule continue to be selected
